Health / Weight Loss

I Did It! Weight-Loss Success Stories

These inspiring people lost weight—sometimes 100 pounds or more—with diet and exercise.

sponsored stories
trending now
  • 16 Ways to Lose Weight Fast
  • 24 Fat-Burning Ab Exercises (No Crunches!)
  • 31 Quick-and-Easy Fat-Burning Recipes
  • Best Superfoods for Weight Loss
  • The 20 Best Foods to Eat for Breakfast
  • 10 Ways to Soothe a Sore Throat

View as one page

View all 1 of 49

Photo: Getty Images

Ready, set, lose

Looking for a little weight-loss motivation? Look no further! Check out these women and their amazing success stories. Whether they stuck to a new meal plan or trained for a marathon, they all reached their feel-great weight goals. Choose your own path and soon you'll be yelling "I did it!" too.

(Want to share your own success story? You can enter your weight-loss story here. We'd love to hear from you!)

1 of 49

View as one page

View all 1 of 49

Photo: Getty Images

Ready, set, lose

Looking for a little weight-loss motivation? Look no further! Check out these women and their amazing success stories. Whether they stuck to a new meal plan or trained for a marathon, they all reached their feel-great weight goals. Choose your own path and soon you'll be yelling "I did it!" too.

(Want to share your own success story? You can enter your weight-loss story here. We'd love to hear from you!)

1 of 49

View as one page

View all 2 of 49

Photo: Tommy Garcia

Maribel Contreras

Age: 38
From: El Monte, Calif.

Now: 140 lbs 
Before: 217 lbs 

How she did it: She registered for a 12-week body transformation contest at my gym. In addition to revving up her workouts, she swapped out her typical fast-food meals for healthier options. In total, she lost 77 pounds.

2 of 49

View as one page

View all 3 of 49

Photo: Felix Sanchez

Nicole Finkbeiner

Age: 33 
From: Houston, Tx. 

Now: 125 lbs 
Before: 170 lbs 

How she did it: She changed her diet and realized that cardio could be more than just slogging along on the elliptical, which helped her drop 45 pounds.

3 of 49

View as one page

View all 4 of 49

Barbara Delamarter

Age: 38
From: Virginia Beach, Va.

Now: 132 lbs
Before: 185 lbs

How she did it: Downloading the MyFitnessPal app and lacing up her running shoes helped Barbara kick 53 pounds to the curb.

4 of 49

View as one page

View all 5 of 49

Jamie Weil

Age: 49
From: Cottonwood, Calif.

Now: 150 lbs.
Then: 235 lbs.

How she did it: She stopped turning to carbs for comfort and worked out daily to shed 85 pounds.

5 of 49

View as one page

View all 6 of 49

Michelle DeGennaro

Age: 43
From: Warwick, NY

Now: 142 lbs.
Then: 244 lbs.

How she did it: On the verge of weight-loss surgery, Michelle gave Nutrisystem and exercise one last try and peeled off an incredible 102 pounds.

6 of 49

View as one page

View all 7 of 49

Chelsea Jackson

Age: 33
From: Atlanta

Now: 140 lbs.
Then: 195 lbs.

How she did it: After realizing a simple one-mile walk had become too difficult, Chelsea decided to eat clean and slip in daily exercise to regain her pre-college figure.

7 of 49

View as one page

View all 8 of 49

Photo: Phoebe Rourke-Ghabriel

Alexis Hinson

Age: 38
From: League City, Texas

Now: 137 lbs.
Then: 188 lbs.

How she did it: Alexis held on to the weight she gained from her two pregnancies for some years, but after joining Weight Watchers she learned all about healthy foods and healthy portions. She kicked the last 20 pounds by slowing training for a marathon with her friends.

8 of 49

View as one page

View all 9 of 49

Jennifer Roe

Age: 40
From: Lodi, NJ

Now: 144 lbs.
Then: 200 lbs.

How she did it: A truly inspiring transformation, Jennifer signed up for a half-marathon despite her distaste for running, and before she knew it began logging serious miles. She worked her way up steadily, and has since completed many half-marathons and 5Ks. She'll soon run in a 200-miles relay race, too.

9 of 49

View as one page

View all 10 of 49

Jennifer Drummond

Age: 40
From: Oakley, CA

Now: 142 lbs.
Then: 175 lbs.

How she did it: Jennifer found the perfect workout companion in her dog, who she took on nightly walks. She also started eating smaller portions and more veggies, as well as using a DVD to get in more fitness time.

10 of 49

View as one page

View all 11 of 49

Marlene Reyes

Age: 38
From: Las Vegas

Now: 130 lbs.
Then: 215 lbs.

How she did it: A notorious yo-yo dieter, Marlene found healthier eating habits with Jenny Craig, but really saw the pounds melt off when she finally incorporated fitness into her lifestyle.

11 of 49

View as one page

View all 12 of 49

Cynthia Barnett

Age: 45
From: Atlanta

Now: 144 lbs.
Then: 186 lbs.

How she did it: Some family and friends went on the journey to lose weight along with Cynthia, and this support system was a driving force in their success. Coupled with DVD workouts and diet changes, she's healthier and happier than ever.

12 of 49

View as one page

View all 13 of 49

Kimberly Linham

Age: 36
From: Glen Allen, VA

Now: 140 lbs.
Then: 235 lbs.

How she did it: Kim's "no excuses" attitude and a slow but steady diet and workout routine helped her eventually shed 95 pounds.

13 of 49

View as one page

View all 14 of 49

Lori Biele

Age: 36
From: Boston, MA

Now: 149 lbs.
Then: 195 lbs.

How she did it: After an injury sidelined this college volleyball star, she gained more than 40 pounds. But after going on Nutrisystem, Lori got her energy back and has now completed several triathlons.

14 of 49

View as one page

View all 15 of 49

Sydney Pershing

Age: 32
From: Miami

Now: 125 lbs, size 4-6
Before: 287 lbs, size 22-24

How she did it: Started biking, first just a few blocks at a time, eventually building up to longer rides. Sydney also started eating more vegetables and lean protein instead of pizza, and eventually lost 162 pounds!

15 of 49

View as one page

View all 16 of 49

Petrita Red

Age: 37
From: San Francisco

Now: 162 lbs, size 12
Before: 274 lbs, size 20

How she did it: Traded candy bars, fast food, and soda for veggies, and started jogging and kickboxing

16 of 49

View as one page

View all 17 of 49

Starla Wilkins

Age: 35
From: Hoover, Alabama

Now: 146 lbs, size 10
Before: 176 lbs, size 14

How she did it: Started playing soccer and Wii Just Dance with her sons and adopted our CarbLovers Diet plan

Jen West

Age: 31
From: Birmingham, Alabama

Now: 145 lbs, size 8
Before: 192 lbs, size 14

How she did it: Started a weight-loss blog and posted photos in a bikini every week to track her progress, upped her exercise, and adopted our CarbLovers Diet plan

Sarah Schallern

Age: 34
From: Falls Church, Virginia

Now: 155 lbs, size 10
Before: 300 lbs, size 28

How she did it: Joined Weight Watchers and started biking

Angie Filardo

Age: 35
From: Verona, Wisconsin

Now: 128 lbs, size 4-6
Before: 368 lbs, size 26-28

How she did it: Cut calories and started exercising, rewarding herself along the way with a new handbag or workout gear for reaching mini targets, like walking 15 minutes each day

20 of 49

View as one page

View all 21 of 49

Doree Kalfen

Age: 52
From: Deerfield, Illinois

Now: 126 lbs, size 4
Before: 230 lbs, size 20

How she did it: Started walking (and then running!) and eating six small meals a day full of fruits, veggies, whole grains, and lean meats

21 of 49

View as one page

View all 22 of 49

Lisa Adelman

Age: 49
From: Boston, Massachusetts

Now: 130 lbs, size 6
Before: 180 lbs, size 14-16

How she did it: Signed up for a 13.1-mile walk to benefit cancer research, and trained for 10 months to prepare. Lisa has since walked a full marathon!

22 of 49

View as one page

View all 23 of 49

Ashli Johnson

Age: 34
From: Cookeville, Tennessee

Now: 140 lbs, size 6-8
Before: 206 lbs, size 14

How she did it: Cut back on calories. Ashli switched to ordering kids' meals at the fast-food restaurants she loves and ate only a serving of her favorite snacks, so she could still enjoy her favorite foods. She also started exercising, and ran a 5K for the first time.

23 of 49

View as one page

View all 24 of 49

Julia Gressick

Age: 28
From: Madison, Wisconsin

Now: 130 lbs, size 6
Before: 223 lbs, size 20

How she did it: Started exercising and using Nutrisystem to help her eat at regular meal times. Julia lost 38 pounds right off the bat, and then upped her exercise routine, finishing her first marathon 93 pounds lighter.

24 of 49

View as one page

View all 25 of 49

Heather Lemanski

Age: 27
From: Detroit, Michigan

Now: 135 lbs
Before: 210 lbs

How she did it: After gaining 70 pounds as a result of kicking her smoking habit, Heather adhered to a simple plan. She could eat whatever she wanted as long as she stayed around 2,000 calories a day. She cut that to 1,800 calories a day, started cycling, and lost 75 pounds!

25 of 49

View as one page

View all 26 of 49

Carter Higgins

Age: 33
From: Burbank, California

Now: 175 lbs
Before: 312 lbs

How she did it: Started going to boot camp five mornings a week, and was motivated to stick with it thanks to the camaraderie. She also kept a food journal, swapping chips for veggies along the way, and dropped 137 pounds in just under a year.

26 of 49

View as one page

View all 27 of 49

Carmen Hollinsed,

Age: 41
From: Briarwood, New York

Now: 130 lbs, size 8
Before: 190 lbs, size 16

How she did it: Starting cooking healthy meals and using a scale and food journal to track everything she ate. Carmen also started walking, and two months later she was logging 10,000 steps a day.

27 of 49

View as one page

View all 28 of 49

Kim Smith

Age: 30
From: Portland, Maine

Now: 150 lbs
Before: 210 lbs

How she did it: Inspired by watching the Ironman World Championship on TV Kim started exercising, working up to 60-90 minutes, five days a week. She ate small meals five times a day and eventually shed 60 lbs. Then, along with her husband, she scaled 19,340 feet of Mt. Kilimanjaro, something she said she never could have done if she hadn't lost the weight.

28 of 49

View as one page

View all 29 of 49

Tracy Ring

Age: 31
From: Chicago

Now: 170 lbs, size 10
Before: 242 lbs, size 20

How she did it: Tried new routines at the gym like spinning, weight lifting, yoga, and cycling, and learned how to make healthier choices at restaurants.

Katherine Harvey

Yep, She Stayed Skinny!

Age: 47
From: Dixfield, Maine

Now: 125 lbs
Before: 196 lbs

How she did it: After a series of illnesses, Katherine's weight shot up by 20 pounds, but she picked up walking and running and even ran her first 5K!

Alisha Schram

Age: 38
From: Enterprise, Alabama

Now: 147 lbs
Before: 210 lbs

How she did it: After struggling to lose the baby weight after her second pregnancy, Alisha started following the Nutrisystem eating plan and joined a gym. Today she takes spinning classes and runs with her husband and says she feels stronger than ever!

Ali Hocart

Age: 39
From: New York City

Now: 137 lbs, size 4
Before: 164 lbs, size 10

How she did it: Adopted our CarbLovers Diet plan, and upped her cardio to five or six workouts a week, plus two or three strength training sessions

View all 33 of 49

Ashley Caudill

Age: 26
From: Valencia, California

Now: 149 lbs
Before: 300 lbs

How she did it: Ashley bought a cheap treadmill and worked out at home until she felt comfortable enough to join a gym. She cut back on fast food and ate small meals throughout the day. She also kept a blog to track her weight loss. Now she's less than half her size!

33 of 49

View all 34 of 49

Meaghan Nelson

Age: 33
From: Jersey City, New Jersey

Now: 113 lbs, size 0
Before: 163 lbs, size 10

How she did it: Stopped drinking alcohol, adopted The South Beach Diet plan, and started walking everywhere

Lisa Oaks

Age: 40
From: Gilbert, Arizona

Now: 132 lbs, size 4-6
Before: 192 lbs, size 16-18

How she did it: Cut out alcohol, ice cream, and excess sugar, and started eating more fresh veggies. Lisa also started walking (and built up to running) and watched 60 pounds melt away in eight months.

35 of 49

View as one page

View all 36 of 49

Melissa Kubiak

Age: 33
From: Lansing, Michigan

Now: 166 lbs
Before: 291 lbs

How she did it: Melissa her friends held their own Biggest Loser-style weight loss contest, and she won! She worked out on an elliptical four days a week and did two weight-training sessions a week, while tracking calories and using meal ideas from Jillian Michaels.

Kimberly Kitchen

Age: 46
From: Camarillo, California

Now: 131 lbs, size 4
Then: 206 lbs, size 22

How she did it: This mom of two laced up her running shoes and slowly but surely ran her way to a healthier weight. Jenny Craig also helped regiment her eating.

37 of 49

View as one page

View all 38 of 49

Mitchie de Leon

Age: 32
From: Long Beach, California

Now: 130 lbs, size 2
Before: 208 lbs, size 14

How she did it: After learning what a portion size really looks like, she cut back on restaurant meals and started eating six small meals a day. Mitchie also conquered her fear of the gym and began exercising, first on the treadmill and then advanced to classes like spinning, boxing, and Tahitian dancing.

38 of 49

View as one page

View all 39 of 49

Amber DeBeer Larson and Amanda Bard

Left: Larson, Age: 30
From: Orrville, Ohio
Now: 135 lbs
Before: 250 lbs

Right: Bard, Age: 27
From: Syracuse, NY
Now: 149 lbs
Before: 245 lbs

How they did it: Walked, talked, and ran off more than 200 pounds after starting new jobs at the University of Buffalo. They joined Weight Watchers and began walking around campus during their breaks. While they live in different cities now, they have found a great excuse to visit each other—running races together.

Nicole Holmes

Age: 30
From: Bronx, New York

Now: 145 lbs
Before: 200 lbs

How she did it: Nicole started walking 30 minutes a day to her job and did strength training at home twice a week to drop 55 pounds over four years. Now she's launching a modeling career!

Heather Harvey

Age: 38
From: Brooklyn, New York

Now: 150 lbs, size 6-8
Before: 233 lbs, size 18-20

How she did it: Heather began exercising and writing down everything she ate. She also started her own line of dishware premarked with portion sizes to continue her weight loss and help other women succeed too!

Audrea Bauer

Age: 32
From: Charles Town, West Virginia

Now: 138 lbs
Before: 200 lbs

How she did it: With 60 extra pounds from the birth of her daughter, Audrea decided to join Weight Watchers and began walking for an hour five days a week. Eight months later (and 62 pounds lighter!) she was elated to fit into a size 8!

View as one page

View all 43 of 49

Tracie Ross

Age: 36 Now: 163 lbs Before: 293 lbs How she did it: When Tracie reached nearly 300 pounds she took charge of her health. She started walking on lunch breaks, cutting calories, and facing emotions head-on instead of eating the pain away. Tracie said jogging and a group of supportive friends helped her keep the weight off for good!

From: O'Fallon, Missouri

Now: 130 lbs
Before: 190 lbs

How she did it: Holly has not only kept the weight off, she ran her first half-marathon earlier this year, pens her own online fitness column, and says it's the first time she's ever felt confident wearing a bikini!

Now: 125 lbs
Before: 198 lbs

How she did it: Hilary cut out sugar and started walking five times a week and lifting weights. After slowly building up to jogging four miles, four to five times a week, she shed over 70 pounds!
